summary.p: This bundle (35 -3034 palm leaf manuscript) contains the Śeṣadharmaprakaraṇam from the Harivamśapurāṇa of Vedavyāsa in Telugu script. This text is complete and contains 58 chapters.

The Harivamśapurāṇa is considered as the supplement to the great epic Mahābhārata. This text appears as a group of mythological tales where the activities of Lord Viṣṇu related to the preservation of the Universe are glorified. His incarnation as Kṛṣṇa is well depicted in this scripture.

The Harivamśapurāṇa is divided into three sections, namely the Harivamśaparva, Viṣṇuparva, and Bhaviṣyaparva where the contents are arranged in chapters. The contents of the text are first recited by Vaiśampāyana to king Janamejaya while Sūta narrated the same to sages at Naimiṣāraṇya. Here, the descriptions are about the creation of the Universe and the glories of Viṣṇu. A number of mythological tales based on these incarnations are depicted. Certain incarnations by Lord Viṣṇu to safeguard the Universe are Matsya, Kūrma, Varāha, Narasimha, Vāmana, etc. Among them, the well known incarnation as Kṛṣṇa is described with great importance.

In the Śeṣadharma, Vaiśampāyana explains to king Janamejaya the entry of Kaliyuga and details on Kaliyuga. This is part of the corpus of Dharmaśāstra, part of the Hindu smṛti, on duties, responsibilities and ethics to oneself, to family and as a member of society. The texts include discussion of stages of life, social classes, and proper goals of life, personal virtues and duties.

msItem.title: Śeṣadharmaprakaraṇam
msItem.author: Vedavyāsa
msItem.incipit: atha te munayaḥ sarve śaunakādyā mahaujasaḥ| sūtaṃ dharmabhṛtāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ papracchuridamādṛtāḥ| sūta sūta mahābhāga sarvaśāstraviśārada| vyāsaprasādāttatsarvaṃ vetsi dharmaśeṣataḥ| bhāratīyāni śāstrāṇi vicitraphalavanti ca| vicitrakathayopetāḥ bhāratīyāḥ kathāḥ śrutāḥ| śrīkṛṣṇacarite divye harivaṃśe yadadbhutam| dharmaṃ dharmavidāṃ śreṣṭha taṃ naḥ śaṃsitumarhasi| śrīsūtaḥ| etadarthaṃ mahāprājño janamejayabhūpatiḥ| pṛṣṭavān muniśārdūlaṃ vaiśampāyanamarthavat| śrījanamejayaḥ|
msItem.explicit: rājyaputradhanaprāptiḥ dhānyaratnapaśūni ca| yasya śravaṇamātreṇa labhate nātra saṃśayaḥ| śrīsūtaḥ| parīkṣitasuto vidvān janamejayabhūpatiḥ| harivaṃśakathāprānte śrutvā grāmaṃ dadau guroḥ| kṛṣṇavākye matiṃ kṛtvā yathā te tuṣitāmahaḥ| amuṃ sadā tvaṃ śṛṇvan pālayatyatha medinīm| bhāratādhyayayanavaryasya śāntiṃ cakre vidhānataḥ| śraddadhānasya pūyante sarvapāpānyanekaśaḥ| kalau doṣaharaṃ nāma dharmaśravaṇapāvanam| śṛṇvatāṃ sarvapāpāni vilayaṃ yānti bhūriśaḥ| varamimamitihāsaṃ śṛṇvatāṃ laukikānāṃ sakaladuritaśāntiḥ sadya evāstu viprāḥ| sa bhavati hariloke bhaktirasmin murārau jagati sakalametaddurlabhaṃ pāpināṃ ca| vyāsāya viṣṇurūpāya vyāsarūpāya viṣṇave| namo vai brahmanidhaye vāsiṣṭhāya namo namaḥ|
msItem.colophon: śrīnivāsāya namaḥ| saṃpādya bhūri kaṣṭena pustakaṃ likhitaṃ mayā| hartumicchati yaḥ pāpī tasya vaṃśakṣayo bhavet|
